0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• maximum recommended dose is 3 mL of the 1% solution (30 mg) per study
  • Lymphangiogram: 0.5 mL of the 1% solution SUBQ into 3 interdigital spaces of each extremity per study; maximum of 3 mL (30 mg)

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness in children have not been established

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: known hypersensitivity to triphenylmethane or related compounds

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• bronchial asthma; serious hypersensitivity reactions more likely
  • interference with arterial blood gas measurement of methemoglobin; falsely high readings
  • interference with measurement of oxygen saturation level by peripheral blood pulse oximetry; falsely low readings; persists up to 4 hours after administration
  • serious hypersensitivity reactions, including life-threatening respiratory distress, shock, and angioedema, have occurred; monitoring recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    • for subcutaneous administration
    • incompatible with local anesthetics; administer in a separate syringe
  • Subcutaneous
    inject SUBQ into interdigital spaces of each extremity per study

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• quality/diagnostic usefulness of lymphography
  • hypersensitivity reactions; minimum of 60 minutes after administration

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Subcutaneous Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • Lymphazurin
    Subcutaneous Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • Novaplus Isosulfan Blue
    Subcutaneous Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • PremierPro Rx Isosulfan Blue
    Subcutaneous Solution: 10 MG/ML

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause discolored urine for up to 24 hours after administration.
  • This drug may cause skin discoloration on a temporary or long-term basis.
